oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of an unidentified U.S. soldier
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This photograph is part of a series of Still Images associated with Batry. B, 114th F.A., 30th Div. Batry. B consisted primarily of Chattanooga area men with prior service in the 1st Tennessee Artillery of the National Guard. The soldier in the photograph wears his issued helmet and overcoat and 1909 pistol cartridge belt with holster. The revolver is most likely a Smith & Wesson or Colt. Behind the soldier is a hut made of wood with the Army tent as a roof. The Still Image was most likely taken at Camp Sevier, S.C.
